result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew E Lohr

records.addlTxt:
9:16 a.m. - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Christian Farina in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court for Andrew E Lohr.  
Defendant Andrew E Lohr in court, in custody.  
Attorney Redetzke requests a plea/sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:25 AM Defendant Andrew E Lohr in court, in custody.  Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court for Andrew E Lohr.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:09 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Andrew E Lohr in court, in custody.  Attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke in court for Andrew E Lohr. 

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Repayment at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing January 1, 2023.  
**pursuant to email dated 09-01-2022 from the Office of the State Public Defender, the defendant is now eligible for SPD appointment.  Attorney to be appointed by SPD prior to next hearing (mjs)

1:00 PM Defendant Andrew E Lohr in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court calls the matter for the Status of Counsel.
The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The Court notes that attorney Redetizke was appointed on his previous cases that were adjudicated. 
The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defendant as to his finances for a court appointed counsel.
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing January 1, 2023.  
The Court tolls the time limits and will adjourn the matter.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:19 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Andrew E Lohr in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Andrew E Lohr. Attorney appears as friend of the court. 

Attorney Herbers states that he was trying to contact Kirk Redetzke.
The Court grants the right to have the Defendant two (2) free phone calls from the Waukesha County Jail.
The Defendant requests to adjourn the matter for one (1) week. 
The Court will adjourn the matter.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Andrew E Lohr
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2022)
Prior: 415 W Park Ave,#3, Waukesha, WI 53186

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to have no contact with Kohl's Department Store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

1:50 PM Defendant Andrew E Lohr in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Mark Maier as a friend of the Court. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
